intro: Lindernia junciformis, commonly known as the spikeless lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple to violet in color, arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. Lindernia junciformis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of ponds. Its foliage is narrow and grass-like, contributing to its overall delicate appearance.
